verses.verse: Then came <S%H935><s%> all the tribes <S%H7626><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%> to Hebron, <S%H2275><s%> and spoke, <S%H559><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H6106><s%> we are your bone and your flesh. <S%H1320><s%>

In times past, <S%H865><s%> when Saul <S%H7586><s%> was king <S%H4428><s%> over us, <S%H3318><s%> it was you who led out and brought in <S%H935><s%> Israel. <S%H3478><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to you, <S%H7462><s%> 'You shall be shepherd of my people <S%H5971><s%> Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and you shall be prince <S%H5057><s%> over Israel. <S%H3478><s%>'"

So all the elders <S%H2205><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to the king <S%H4428><s%> to Hebron; <S%H2275><s%> and king <S%H4428><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with them in Hebron <S%H2275><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Yahweh; <S%H3068><s%> and they anointed <S%H4886><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> over Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
David <S%H1732><s%> was thirty <S%H7970><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign, <S%H4427><s%> and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%>

In Hebron <S%H2275><s%> he reigned <S%H4427><s%> over Judah <S%H3063><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> and six <S%H8337><s%> months; <S%H2320><s%> and in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> he reigned <S%H4427><s%> thirty-three <S%H7970><s%> <S%H7969><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> over all Israel <S%H3478><s%> and Judah. <S%H3063><s%>

The king <S%H4428><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> to Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> against the Jebusites, <S%H2983><s%> the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> who spoke <S%H559><s%> to David, <S%H1732><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Unless you take away <S%H5493><s%> the blind <S%H5787><s%> and the lame, <S%H6455><s%> you shall not come in <S%H935><s%> here; <S%H559><s%>" thinking, "David <S%H1732><s%> can't <S%H935><s%> come in here."
Nevertheless David <S%H1732><s%> took <S%H3920><s%> the stronghold <S%H4686><s%> of Zion; <S%H6726><s%> the same is the city <S%H5892><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%>

David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> on that day, <S%H3117><s%> "Whoever strikes <S%H5221><s%> the Jebusites, <S%H2983><s%> let him get up <S%H5060><s%> to the watercourse, <S%H6794><s%> and strike the lame <S%H6455><s%> and the blind, <S%H5787><s%> who are hated <S%H8130><s%> by David <S%H1732><s%>'s soul. <S%H5315><s%>" Therefore they say, <S%H559><s%> "The blind <S%H5787><s%> and the lame <S%H6455><s%> can't <S%H935><s%> come into the house. <S%H1004><s%>"

David <S%H1732><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the stronghold, <S%H4686><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> it the city <S%H5892><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> built <S%H1129><s%> around <S%H5439><s%> from Millo <S%H4407><s%> and inward. <S%H1004><s%>
David <S%H1732><s%> grew <S%H3212><s%> greater <S%H1419><s%> and greater; <S%H1980><s%> for Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Armies, <S%H6635><s%> was with him.

Hiram <S%H2438><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Tyre <S%H6865><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> to David, <S%H1732><s%> and cedar <S%H730><s%> trees, <S%H6086><s%> and carpenters, <S%H2796><s%> and masons; <S%H7023><s%> and they built <S%H1129><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> a house. <S%H1004><s%>

David <S%H1732><s%> perceived <S%H3045><s%> that Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> had established <S%H3559><s%> him king <S%H4428><s%> over Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and that he had exalted <S%H5375><s%> his kingdom <S%H4467><s%> for his people <S%H5971><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%>'s sake.

David <S%H1732><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> him more concubines <S%H6370><s%> and wives <S%H802><s%> out of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he had come <S%H935><s%> from Hebron; <S%H2275><s%> and there were yet sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters <S%H1323><s%> born <S%H3205><s%> to David. <S%H1732><s%>

These are the names <S%H8034><s%> of those who were born <S%H3209><s%> to him in Jerusalem: <S%H3389><s%> Shammua, <S%H8051><s%> and Shobab, <S%H7727><s%> and Nathan, <S%H5416><s%> and Solomon, <S%H8010><s%>
and Ibhar, <S%H2984><s%> and Elishua, <S%H474><s%> and Nepheg, <S%H5298><s%> and Japhia, <S%H3309><s%>
and Elishama, <S%H476><s%> and Eliada, <S%H450><s%> and Eliphelet. <S%H467><s%>

When the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> that they had anointed <S%H4886><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> over Israel, <S%H3478><s%> all the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> David; <S%H1732><s%> and David <S%H1732><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> of it, <S%H3381><s%> and went down to the stronghold. <S%H4686><s%>
Now the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> had come <S%H935><s%> and spread <S%H5203><s%> themselves in the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Rephaim. <S%H7497><s%>

David <S%H1732><s%> inquired <S%H7592><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Shall I go up <S%H5927><s%> against the Philistines? <S%H6430><s%> Will you deliver <S%H5414><s%> them into my hand? <S%H3027><s%>" Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to David, <S%H1732><s%> "Go up; <S%H5927><s%> for I will certainly <S%H5414><s%> deliver <S%H5414><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> into your hand. <S%H3027><s%>"

David <S%H1732><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Baal Perazim, <S%H1732><s%> and David struck <S%H5221><s%> them there; <S%H559><s%> and he said, "Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> has broken <S%H6555><s%> my enemies <S%H341><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me, <S%H6556><s%> like the breach of waters. <S%H4325><s%>" Therefore he called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of that place Baal Perazim. <S%H4725><s%>
They left <S%H5800><s%> their images <S%H6091><s%> there; <S%H1732><s%> and David and his men <S%H582><s%> took them away. <S%H5375><s%>
The Philistines <S%H6430><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> yet again, <S%H3254><s%> and spread <S%H5203><s%> themselves in the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Rephaim. <S%H7497><s%>

When David <S%H1732><s%> inquired <S%H7592><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> he said, <S%H559><s%> "You shall not go up. <S%H5927><s%> Circle <S%H5437><s%> around behind <S%H310><s%> them, <S%H935><s%> and attack them over against <S%H4136><s%> the mulberry trees. <S%H1057><s%>

It shall be, <S%H8085><s%> when you hear the sound <S%H6963><s%> of marching <S%H6807><s%> in the tops <S%H7218><s%> of the mulberry trees, <S%H1057><s%> that then you shall stir <S%H2782><s%> yourself up; <S%H3068><s%> for then Yahweh has gone out <S%H3318><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you to strike <S%H5221><s%> the army <S%H4264><s%> of the Philistines. <S%H6430><s%>"

David <S%H1732><s%> did so, <S%H6213><s%> as Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> him, <S%H5221><s%> and struck the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> from Geba <S%H1387><s%> until you come <S%H935><s%> to Gezer. <S%H1507><s%>
